summary: ISOIEC 8652 Information technology  Programming languages  Ada is the international standard for the computer programming language Ada. It was produced by the Ada Working Group, ISOIEC JTC1SC22WG 9, of the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) and the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC).
japaneseSummary: Ada言語の国際標準規格。

name: J# J sharp
summary: Visual J is a discontinued implementation of the J programming language that was a transitional language for programmers of Java and Visual J languages, so they could use their existing knowledge and applications with the .NET Framework. It was introduced in 2002 and discontinued in 2007, with support for the final release of the product continuing until October 2017.
japaneseSummary: .NET対応のJ言語。Java/Visual Jからの移行言語。

name: JADE
summary: JADE is a proprietary object-oriented software development and deployment platform product from the New Zealand-based Jade Software Corporation, first released in 1996.
japaneseSummary: ニュージーランドJade Software社のオブジェクト指向開発・実行プラットフォーム。

name: Jai
summary: Jonathan Blow is an American video game designer and programmer. He is best known for his work on the independent video games Braid (2008) and The Witness (2016).
japaneseSummary: ジョナサン・ブロー氏によるゲーム開発言語。

name: JAL
summary: JAL (Just Another Language) is a Pascal-like programming language and compiler that generates executable code for PIC microcontrollers. It is a free-format language with a compiler that runs on Linux, MS-Windows and MS-DOS (OSX support). It is configurable and extendable through the use of libraries and can even be combined with PIC assembly language.
japaneseSummary: PICマイコン向け、Pascal風コンパイラ言語。

name: JASS
summary: Warcraft III: Reign of Chaos is a high fantasy real-time strategy computer video game developed and published by Blizzard Entertainment released in July 2002. It is the second sequel to Warcraft: Orcs  Humans, after Warcraft II: Tides of Darkness, the third game set in the Warcraft fictional universe, and the first to be rendered in three dimensions. An expansion pack, The Frozen Throne, was released in July 2003.
japaneseSummary: Warcraft IIIのスクリプト言語。

name: Java
summary: Java is a high-level, general-purpose, memory-safe, object-oriented programming language. It is intended to let programmers write once, run anywhere (WORA), meaning that compiled Java code can run on all platforms that support Java without the need to recompile. Java applications are typically compiled to bytecode that can run on any Java virtual machine (JVM) regardless of the underlying computer architecture.
japaneseSummary: オブジェクト指向の汎用プログラミング言語。プラットフォーム独立で動作する。

name: JavaFX Script
summary: JavaFX Script was a scripting language designed by Sun Microsystems, forming part of the JavaFX family of technologies on the Java Platform.
japaneseSummary: JavaプラットフォームのJavaFX技術の一部、Sun Microsystemsが開発したスクリプト言語。

name: JavaScript
summary: JavaScript, often abbreviated as JS, is a programming language and core technology of the World Wide Web, alongside HTML and CSS.
japaneseSummary: Webページの動的機能を実現するプログラミング言語。

name: JCL
summary: Job Control Language (JCL) is a scripting language used on IBM mainframe operating systems to instruct the system on how to run a batch job or start a subsystem. The purpose of JCL is to say which programs to run, using which files or devices for input or output, and at times to also indicate under what conditions to skip a step. Parameters in the JCL can also provide accounting information for tracking the resources used by a job as well as which machine the job should run on.
japaneseSummary: IBMメインフレームのジョブ制御言語。バッチ処理やサブシステム起動を記述。

name: JEAN
summary: JEAN was a dialect of the JOSS programming language developed for and used on ICT 1900 series computers in the late 1960s and early 1970s; it was implemented under the MINIMOP operating system. It was used at universities including the University of Southampton. The name was an acronym derived from "JOSS Extended and Adapted for Nineteen-hundred".
japaneseSummary: 1960～70年代のICT 1900シリーズ用JOSS方言。

name: Jess
summary: Jess is a rule engine for the Java computing platform, written in the Java programming language. It was developed by Ernest Friedman-Hill of Sandia National Laboratories. It is a superset of the CLIPS language.
japaneseSummary: Javaで記述されたルールエンジン。CLIPSのスーパーセット。

name: Join Java
summary: Compared to the use of threads and locks, this is a high level programming model using communication constructs model to abstract the complexity of concurrent environment and to allow scalability. Its focus is on the execution of a chord between messages atomically consumed from a group of channels.
japaneseSummary: メッセージ通信を用いた高レベルな並列処理モデル。

name: JOSS
summary: JOSS was one of the first interactive, time-sharing programming languages. It pioneered many features that would become common in languages from the 1960s into the 1980s, including use of line numbers as both editing instructions and targets for branches, statements predicated by Boolean decisions, and a built-in source-code editor that can perform instructions in direct or immediate mode, what they termed a conversational user interface.
japaneseSummary: インタラクティブな初期のプログラミング言語。分岐や条件分岐、エディタ機能を備えた対話型操作をサポート。

name: Joule
summary: Joule is a capability-secure massively-concurrent dataflow programming language, designed for building distributed applications. It is so concurrent that the order of statements within a block is irrelevant to the operation of the block. Statements are executed whenever possible, based on their inputs.
japaneseSummary: 分散アプリ開発向け、能力安全な並列データフロー言語。

name: JOVIAL
summary: JOVIAL is a high-level programming language based on ALGOL 58, specialized for developing embedded systems. It was a major system programming language through the 1960s and 1970s.
japaneseSummary: 組み込みシステム向け高級言語。ALGOL 58を基に開発された。

name: Joy
summary: The Joy programming language in computer science is a purely functional programming language that was produced by Manfred von Thun of La Trobe University in Melbourne, Australia. Joy is based on composition of functions rather than lambda calculus. It was inspired by the function-level programming style of John Backus's FP.
japaneseSummary: 関数合成を基にした純粋関数型言語。

name: jq
summary: jq is a very high-level lexically scoped functional programming language in which every JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) value is a constant. jq supports backtracking and managing indefinitely long streams of JSON data. It is related to two programming languagesIcon and Haskell. The language supports a namespace-based module system and has some support for closures. functions and functional expressions can be used as parameters of other functions.
japaneseSummary: JSONデータ処理の関数型言語。

name: JScript
summary: JScript is Microsoft's legacy dialect of the ECMAScript standard that is used in Microsoft's Internet Explorer web browser and HTML Applications, and as a standalone Windows scripting language.
japaneseSummary: マイクロソフトのECMAScript方言。IEやHTMLアプリケーション、スタンドアロンスクリプト言語。

name: JScript .NET
summary: JScript .NET is a .NET programming language developed by Microsoft.
japaneseSummary: マイクロソフトが開発した.NETプログラミング言語。

name: Julia
summary: Julia is a high-level, general-purpose dynamic programming language, designed to be fast and productive, for e.g. data science, artificial intelligence, machine learning, modeling and simulation, most commonly used for numerical analysis and computational science.
japaneseSummary: 数値計算・科学技術向け高速高水準言語。

name: Jython
summary: Jython is an implementation of the Python programming language designed to run on the Java platform. It was known as JPython until 1999.
japaneseSummary: Javaプラットフォームで動作するPythonの実装。

name: Kaleidoscope
summary: The Kaleidoscope programming language is a constraint programming language embedding constraints into an imperative object-oriented language. Objects have constraint constructors, which are not methods, to enforce the meanings of user-defined datatypes.
japaneseSummary: 制約プログラミング言語。オブジェクト指向で、データ型の意味を制約で記述。

name: Karel
summary: Karel is an educational programming language for beginners, created by Richard E. The language is named after Karel apek, a Czech writer who introduced the word robot in his play R.U.R.
japaneseSummary: 初心者向け教育用プログラミング言語。

name: KEE
summary: IntelliCorp (IC) was an American software company based in Silicon Valley.
japaneseSummary: KEEは、米国のソフトウェア会社IntelliCorpが開発した言語。

name: KIF Knowledge Interchange Format
summary: Knowledge Interchange Format (KIF) is a computer language designed to enable systems to share and re-use information from knowledge-based systems. KIF is similar to frame languages such as KL-One and LOOM but unlike such language its primary role is not intended as a framework for the expression or use of knowledge but rather for the interchange of knowledge between systems. PostScript was not designed primarily as a language to store and manipulate documents but rather as an interchange format for systems and devices to share documents.
japaneseSummary: 知識交換フォーマット。異なるシステム間で知識を共有する言語。

name: Kixtart
summary: KiXtart is a closed source free-format scripting language for Windows. It is described as a logon script processor and enhanced batch scripting language by the official website. Its name is a portmanteau of "kick start".
japaneseSummary: Windows用、閉源の自由形式スクリプト言語。ログオンスクリプト処理やバッチスクリプト強化。

name: Kodu
summary: Kodu Game Lab, originally named Boku, is a programming integrated development environment (IDE) by Microsoft's FUSE Labs. It was released on the Xbox Live Marketplace on June 30, 2009. A Windows version is available to the general public for download from Microsoft's FUSE web portal.
japaneseSummary: マイクロソフトのゲームプログラミング環境。

name: Kojo
summary: Kojo is a programming language and integrated development environment (IDE) for computer programming and learning. It has many different features that enable playing, exploring, creating, and learning in the areas of computer programming, mental skills, (interactive) math, graphics, art, music, science, animation, games, and electronics.
japaneseSummary: コンピュータプログラミング学習用言語と統合開発環境。多様な機能で、プログラミング、思考力、インタラクティブな数学、グラフィック、アート、音楽、科学、アニメーション、ゲーム、電子工作を学ぶ。

name: KornShell ksh
summary: KornShell (ksh) is a Unix shell which was developed by David Korn at Bell Labs in the early 1980s and announced at USENIX on July 14, 1983. The initial development was based on Bourne shell source code. Other early contributors were Bell Labs developers Mike Veach and Pat Sullivan, who wrote the Emacs and vi-style line editing modes' code, respectively.
japaneseSummary: UNIXシェル。Bourneシェルを基に開発された。

name: Kotlin
summary: Kotlin is a cross-platform, statically typed, general-purpose high-level programming language with type inference. Kotlin is designed to interoperate fully with Java, and the JVM version of Kotlin's standard library depends on the Java Class Library, but type inference allows its syntax to be more concise. Language development costs are borne by JetBrains, while the Kotlin Foundation protects the Kotlin trademark.
japaneseSummary: クロスプラットフォームの静的型付け言語。Javaとの互換性も高く、簡潔な構文も特徴。

name: KRC
summary: KRC is a lazy functional language developed by David Turner from November 1979 to October 1981 based on SASL, with pattern matching, guards and ZF expressions. Two implementations of KRC were written: David Turner's original one in BCPL running on EMAS, and Simon J. Croft's later one in C under Unix, and KRC was the main language used for teaching functional programming at the University of Kent at Canterbury (UK) from 1982 to 1985.
japaneseSummary: 遅延評価関数型言語。パターンマッチング、ガード、ZF式をサポート。

name: KRL
summary: KRL is a knowledge representation language, developed by Daniel G. It is a frame-based language. KRL was an attempt to produce a language which was nice to read and write for the engineers who had to write programs in it, processed like human memory, so you could have realistic AI programs, had an underlying semantics which was firmly grounded like logic languages, all in one, all in one language.
japaneseSummary: 知識表現言語。フレームベースで、人間的記憶処理を模倣。

name: KRYPTON
summary: KL-ONE is a knowledge representation system in the tradition of semantic networks and frames; that is, it is a frame language. The system is an attempt to overcome semantic indistinctness in semantic network representations and to explicitly represent conceptual information as a structured inheritance network.
japaneseSummary: 知識表現システム。フレーム言語で、概念を継承ネットワークで表現。

name: Kv Kivy
summary: Kivy is a free and open source Python framework for developing mobile apps and other multitouch application software with a natural user interface (NUI). It is distributed under the terms of the MIT License, and can run on Android, iOS, Linux, macOS, and Windows.
japaneseSummary: マルチタッチアプリ開発用Pythonフレームワーク。

name: LabVIEW
summary: Laboratory Virtual Instrument Engineering Workbench (LabVIEW) is a graphical system design and development platform produced and distributed by National Instruments, based on a programming environment that uses a visual programming language. It is widely used for data acquisition, instrument control, and industrial automation.
japaneseSummary: 視覚プログラミング言語を用いた計測制御開発環境。

name: Ladder
summary: Ladder logic was originally a written method to document the design and construction of relay racks as used in manufacturing and process control. Each device in the relay rack would be represented by a symbol on the ladder diagram with connections between those devices shown. In addition, other items external to the relay rack such as pumps, heaters, and so forth would also be shown on the ladder diagram.
japaneseSummary: 製造・プロセス制御の継電器ラック設計を図示する言語。

name: LANSA
summary: LANSA is an integrated development environment (IDE) for building desktop, web, and mobile software applications that can be deployed to Cloud, Windows, Linux, and IBM server platforms. The main feature of the LANSA environment is the 'RDML  RDMLX' languagewhich is classified as a 4GL. CL is the "scripting language" equivalent of the OS400 operating system.
japaneseSummary: デスクトップ/Web/モバイルアプリ開発統合環境。4GLのRDML/RDMLX言語とOS/400スクリプト言語CLを備える。

name: Lasso
summary: Lasso is an application server and server management interface designed to develop internet applications. It is also a general-purpose, high-level programming language. Originally a web datasource connection tool for Filemaker and later included in Apple Computer's FileMaker 4.0 and Claris Homepage as CDML, it has since evolved into a complex language used to develop and serve large-scale internet applications and web pages.
japaneseSummary: Webアプリケーション開発用、汎用高級言語。

name: LC-3
summary: Little Computer 3, or LC-3, is a type of computer educational programming language, an assembly language, which is a type of low-level programming language.
japaneseSummary: LC-3は、低水準言語であるアセンブリ言語の教育用コンピュータ。

name: Lean
summary: Lean is a proof assistant and a functional programming language. It is based on the calculus of constructions with inductive types. It is an open-source project hosted on GitHub.
japaneseSummary: 証明支援と関数型プログラミング言語。 inductive typesを用いる。オープンソース。

name: Legoscript
summary: Lego Mindstorms is a discontinued line of educational kits for building programmable robots based on Lego bricks. It was introduced on 1 September 1998 and discontinued on 31 December 2022.
japaneseSummary: レゴブロックでプログラミング可能なロボットを構築する教育用キット。

name: LIL
summary: LIL, the Little Implementation Language, was a system programming language during the early days of Unix history on PDP-11 machines. It was written by P.
japaneseSummary: PDP-11用システムプログラミング言語。

name: LilyPond
summary: LilyPond is a computer program and file format for music engraving. One of LilyPond's major goals is to produce scores that are engraved with traditional layout rules, reflecting the era when scores were engraved by hand.
japaneseSummary: 楽譜作成プログラム。伝統的なレイアウト規則で高品質な楽譜を生成。

name: Limbo
summary: Limbo is a programming language for writing distributed systems and is the language used to write applications for the Inferno operating system. It was designed at Bell Labs by Sean Dorward, Phil Winterbottom, and Rob Pike.
japaneseSummary: 分散システム開発言語。Inferno OS用。

name: LINC
summary: LINC is a fourth-generation programming language, used mostly on Unisys computer systems.
japaneseSummary: ユニシス系コンピュータで主に用いられる第4世代言語。

name: Lingo
summary: Lingo is a verbose object-oriented (OO) scripting language developed by John H. Lingo is used to develop desktop application software, interactive kiosks, CD-ROMs and Adobe Shockwave content.
japaneseSummary: オブジェクト指向スクリプト言語。デスクトップアプリ開発などに用いられる。

name: LINQ
summary: Language Integrated Query is a Microsoft .NET Framework component that adds native data querying capabilities to .NET languages, originally released as a major part of .NET Framework 3.5 in 2007.
japaneseSummary: .NET言語にクエリ機能を追加するMicrosoftのコンポーネント。

name: LIS
summary: LIS was a system implementation programming language designed by Jean Ichbiah, who later designed Ada.
japaneseSummary: アダ言語の開発者により設計されたシステム実装言語。

name: LISA
summary: LISA is a language to describe the instruction set architecture of a processor.
japaneseSummary: プロセッサ命令セットを記述する言語。

name: Lisp
summary: Lisp is a family of programming languages with a long history and a distinctive, fully parenthesized prefix notation. Originally specified in the late 1950s, it is the second-oldest high-level programming language still in common use, after Fortran. Lisp has changed since its early days, and many dialects have existed over its history.
japaneseSummary: 括弧記法の関数型言語。歴史が長く、多くの派生言語がある。

name: Lithe
summary: Lithe is an experimental programming language created in 1982 by David Sandberg at the University of Washington which allows the programmer to freely choose their own syntax.
japaneseSummary: 1982年、ワシントン大学で開発された、構文自由な実験的プログラミング言語。

name: Little b
summary: Little b is a domain-specific programming language, more specifically, a modeling language, designed to build modular mathematical models of biological systems. It was designed and authored by Aneil Mallavarapu. Little b is being developed in the Virtual Cell Program at Harvard Medical School, headed by mathematician Jeremy Gunawardena.
japaneseSummary: 生物系システムの数学モデル構築用、ドメイン特化言語。

name: LiveCode
summary: LiveCode is a cross-platform rapid application development runtime system inspired by HyperCard.
japaneseSummary: クロスプラットフォームの高速アプリ開発実行環境。

name: LiveScript
summary: LiveScript is a functional programming language that transpiles to JavaScript. It was created by Jeremy Ashkenas, the creator of CoffeeScript, along with Satoshi Muramaki, George Zahariev, and many others.
japaneseSummary: JavaScriptに変換される関数型言語。

name: LLL
summary: Ethereum is a decentralized blockchain with smart contract functionality. Ether is the native cryptocurrency of the platform. Among cryptocurrencies, ether is second only to bitcoin in market capitalization.
japaneseSummary: Ethereumは分散型ブロックチェーンで、スマートコントラクト機能を持つ。

name: Logo
summary: Logo is an educational programming language, designed in 1967 by Wally Feurzeig, Seymour Papert, and Cynthia Solomon. The name was coined by Feurzeig while he was at Bolt, Beranek and Newman, and derives from the Greek logos, meaning 'word' or 'thought'.
japaneseSummary: 教育用プログラミング言語。

name: LotusScript
summary: LotusScript is an object-oriented programming language used by Lotus Notes and other IBM Lotus Software products.
japaneseSummary: Lotus Notes等のIBM製品で利用されるオブジェクト指向言語。

name: LPC
summary: LPMud, abbreviated LP, is a family of multi-user dungeon (MUD) server software. Its first instance, the original LPMud game driver, was developed in 1989 by Lars Pensj. LPMud was innovative in its separation of the MUD infrastructure into a virtual machine and a development framework written in the programming language LPC.
japaneseSummary: マルチユーザーダンジョン(MUD)サーバ構築用言語。

name: LSE
summary: LSE is a programming language developed at Suplec and Tlmcanique from the late 1960s to the mid-1970s. It is similar to BASIC, except with French-language instead of English-language keywords. It was derived from an earlier language called LSD, also developed at Suplec.
japaneseSummary: フランス語キーワードを用いた、BASIC類似のプログラミング言語。

name: LSL
summary: Second Life is a multiplayer virtual world that allows people to create an avatar for themselves and then interact with other users and user-created content within a multi-user online environment. In many ways, Second Life is similar to massively multiplayer online role-playing video games; nevertheless, Linden Lab is emphatic that their creation is not a game: "There is no manufactured conflict, no set objective."
japaneseSummary: 複数ユーザー向け仮想世界「セカンドライフ」のプログラミング言語。

name: Lua
summary: Lua is a lightweight, high-level, multi-paradigm programming language designed mainly for embedded use in applications. Lua is cross-platform software, since the interpreter of compiled bytecode is written in ANSI C, and Lua has a relatively simple C application programming interface (API) to embed it into applications.
japaneseSummary: 埋め込み用途向け軽量スクリプト言語。

name: Lucid
summary: Lucid is a dataflow programming language designed to experiment with non-von Neumann programming models. It was designed by Bill Wadge and Ed Ashcroft and described in the 1985 book Lucid, the Dataflow Programming Language.
japaneseSummary: データフロー型のプログラミング言語。非フォン・ノイマン型モデルの実験に用いられる。

name: Lustre
summary: Lustre is a formally defined, declarative, and synchronous dataflow programming language for programming reactive systems. A formal presentation of the language can be found in the 1991 Proceedings of the IEEE. It is now used for critical control software in aircraft, helicopters, and nuclear power plants.
japaneseSummary: リアクティブシステム向け、形式定義・宣言型・同期データフロー言語。

name: LYaPAS
summary: Logical Language for the Representation of Synthesis Algorithms is a programming language created by Arkady Zakrevsky in the Soviet Union.
japaneseSummary: 合成アルゴリズム記述のための論理言語。

name: Lynx
summary: Lynx is a programming language for large distributed networks, using remote procedure calls. It was developed by the University of WisconsinMadison in 1984 for the Charlotte multicomputer operating system.
japaneseSummary: 分散大規模ネットワーク向け、遠隔手続き呼出し言語。

name: M4
summary: m4 is a general-purpose macro processor included in most Unix-like operating systems, and is a component of the POSIX standard.
japaneseSummary: Unix系OSに含まれる汎用マクロ処理系。

name: Machine code
summary: In computer programming, machine code is computer code consisting of machine language instructions, which are used to control a computer's central processing unit (CPU). For conventional binary computers, machine code is the binary representation of a computer program that is actually read and interpreted by the computer.
japaneseSummary: コンピュータのCPUを制御する機械語命令の集合体。

name: Macsyma
summary: Macsyma is one of the oldest general-purpose computer algebra systems still in wide use. It was originally developed from 1968 to 1982 at MIT's Project MAC.
japaneseSummary: 古い汎用コンピュータ代数システム。MITで開発。

name: MAD
summary: MAD is a programming language and compiler for the IBM 704 and later the IBM 709, IBM 7090, IBM 7040, UNIVAC 1107, UNIVAC 1108, Philco 210-211, and eventually IBM System370 mainframe computers. Graham, MAD is a variant of the ALGOL language. It was widely used to teach programming at colleges and universities during the 1960s and played a minor role in the development of Compatible Time-Sharing System (CTSS), Multics, and the Michigan Terminal System computer operating systems.
japaneseSummary: ALGOL派生言語。IBMメインフレーム等で利用。

name: MADI
summary: MAD is a programming language and compiler for the IBM 704 and later the IBM 709, IBM 7090, IBM 7040, UNIVAC 1107, UNIVAC 1108, Philco 210-211, and eventually IBM System370 mainframe computers. Graham, MAD is a variant of the ALGOL language. It was widely used to teach programming at colleges and universities during the 1960s and played a minor role in the development of Compatible Time-Sharing System (CTSS), Multics, and the Michigan Terminal System computer operating systems.
japaneseSummary: ALGOL派生言語。IBMメインフレーム等で用いられた。

name: Magik
summary: Magik is an object-oriented programming language that supports multiple inheritance and polymorphism, and it is dynamically typed. It was designed and implemented in 1989 by Arthur Chance of Smallworld Systems Ltd. as part of Smallworld Geographical Information System (GIS). Following Smallworld's acquisition in 2000, Magik is now provided by GE Energy, still as part of its Smallworld technology platform.
japaneseSummary: オブジェクト指向言語。多重継承・多態性対応。動的型付け。

name: Magma
summary: Magma is a computer algebra system designed to solve problems in algebra, number theory, geometry and combinatorics. It is named after the algebraic structure magma.
japaneseSummary: 代数、数論、幾何、組合せ論の問題を解くコンピュータ代数システム。

name: Maple
summary: Maple is a symbolic and numeric computing environment as well as a multi-paradigm programming language.
japaneseSummary: 記号・数値計算環境と多言語プログラミング言語。

name: MAPPER
summary: MAPPER Systems, now known as Business Information Server, BIS, is a fourth-generation programming language originally from Sperry Univac. Mapper originated in the 1970s based on some work in the 1960s, It has been functionally enhanced and kept current. It was also given an extension named ICE - Internet Commerce Enabler.
japaneseSummary: 1970年代に開発された、Sperry Univac社の4世代プログラミング言語。

name: MARK-IV
summary: Mark IV is a fourth-generation programming language that was created by Informatics, Inc. in the 1960s. At the time, this program was called a file management system, though it was not what today is understood by that term ; rather, it was what today would be known as a report generator.
japaneseSummary: 1960年代の報告書生成言語。

name: Mary
summary: Mary is a programming language designed and implemented by Mark Rain at RUNIT in Trondheim, Norway during the 1970s. It borrowed many features from ALGOL 68 but was designed for systems programming, with a subset of operations being reserved for higher-level usage.
japaneseSummary: 1970年代ノルウェーで開発されたシステムプログラミング言語。ALGOL 68の影響を受け、一部は高水準用途に予約。

name: MASM Microsoft Assembly x86
summary: Microsoft Macro Assembler (MASM) is an x86 assembler that uses the Intel syntax for MS-DOS and Microsoft Windows. Beginning with MASM 8.0, there are two versions of the assembler: One for 16-bit  32-bit assembly sources, and another (ML64) for 64-bit sources only.
japaneseSummary: x86アセンブラ。Intel構文でMS-DOS/Windows用。16/32/64ビット対応。

name: MATH-MATIC
summary: MATH-MATIC is the marketing name for the AT-3 compiler, an early programming language for the UNIVAC I and UNIVAC II.
japaneseSummary: UNIVAC I/II用初期コンパイラ言語。

name: MATLAB
summary: MATLAB is a proprietary multi-paradigm programming language and numeric computing environment developed by MathWorks.
japaneseSummary: MathWorks社が開発した、マルチパラダイムのプログラミング言語と数値計算環境。

name: Max
summary: Max, also known as MaxMSPJitter, is a visual programming language for music and multimedia developed and maintained by San Francisco-based software company Cycling '74. Over its more than thirty-year history, it has been used by composers, performers, software designers, researchers, and artists to create recordings, performances, and installations.
japaneseSummary: 音楽・映像用ビジュアルプログラミング言語。

name: Maxima
summary: Maxima is a software package for performing computer algebra calculations in mathematics and the physical sciences. It is written in Common Lisp and runs on all POSIX platforms such as macOS, Unix, BSD, and Linux, as well as under Microsoft Windows and Android. It is free software released under the terms of the GNU General Public License (GPL).
japaneseSummary: コンピュータ代数計算ソフト。GNU GPLで公開。

name: MaxScript
summary: Autodesk 3ds Max, formerly 3D Studio and 3D Studio Max, is a professional 3D computer graphics program for making 3D animations, models, games and images. It is developed and produced by Autodesk Media and Entertainment. It has modeling capabilities and a flexible plugin architecture and must be used on the Microsoft Windows platform.
japaneseSummary: 3ds Max用スクリプト言語。

name: Maya MEL
summary: The Maya Embedded Language (MEL) is a scripting language used to simplify tasks in the 3D graphics software Autodesk Maya. Most tasks that can be achieved through Maya's GUI can be achieved with MEL, as well as certain tasks that are not available from the GUI.
japaneseSummary: Autodesk Mayaのスクリプト言語。GUI操作を自動化。

name: MDL
summary: MDL is a programming language, a descendant of the language Lisp. Its initial purpose was to provide high-level programming language support for the Dynamic Modeling Group at Massachusetts Institute of Technology's (MIT) Project MAC. It was developed in 1971 on a PDP-10 running ITS and later ran on TENEX, TOPS-20, BSD, and AEGIS.
japaneseSummary: Lisp派生言語。MITの動的モデリンググループ向け高水準言語。

name: Mercury
summary: Mercury is a functional logic programming language made for real-world uses. The first version was developed at the University of Melbourne, Computer Science department, by Fergus Henderson, Thomas Conway, and Zoltan Somogyi, under Somogyi's supervision, and released on April 8, 1995.
japaneseSummary: 実用的な関数型論理プログラミング言語。

name: Mesa
summary: Mesa is a programming language developed in the mid 1970s at the Xerox Palo Alto Research Center in Palo Alto, California, United States. The language name was a pun based upon the programming language catchphrases of the time, because Mesa is a "high level" programming language.
japaneseSummary: 1970年代にXerox PARCで開発された高級言語。

name: Microcode
summary: A microassembler is a computer program that helps prepare a microprogram, called firmware, to control the low level operation of a computer in much the same way an assembler helps prepare higher level code for a processor. The difference is that the microprogram is usually only developed by the processor manufacturer and works intimately with the computer hardware. On a microprogrammed computer the microprogram implements the operations of the instruction set in which any normal program is written.
japaneseSummary: マイクロプロセッサの動作を制御するファームウェアを開発するアセンブラ。

name: Microsoft Power Fx
summary: Microsoft Power Fx is a free and open source low-code, general-purpose programming language for expressing logic across the Microsoft Power Platform.
japaneseSummary: Microsoft Power Platform向け、低コードの汎用プログラミング言語。

name: MIIS
summary: MIIS is a MUMPS-like programming language that was created by A.Neil Pappalardo and Curt W. When many MUMPS implementations standardized to be compatible, MIIS did not standardize, but became a proprietary system instead.
japaneseSummary: MUMPS言語に類似した、独自のプログラミング言語。

name: MIMIC
summary: MIMIC, known in capitalized form only, is a former simulation computer language developed 1964 by H. It is an expression-oriented continuous block simulation language, but capable of incorporating blocks of FORTRAN-like algebra.
japaneseSummary: 1964年開発の式指向連続ブロックシミュレーション言語。

name: Mirah
summary: Mirah has been a programming language based on Ruby language syntax, local type inference, hybrid staticdynamic type system, and a pluggable compiler toolchain. Mirah was created by Charles Oliver Nutter to be "a 'Ruby-like' language, probably a subset of Ruby syntax, that could compile to solid, fast, idiomatic JVM bytecode." The word mirah refers to the gemstone ruby in the Javanese language, a play on the concept of Ruby in Java.
japaneseSummary: Ruby構文、静的/動的型推論、JVMバイトコード生成を特徴とするプログラミング言語。

name: Miranda
summary: Miranda is a lazy, purely functional programming language designed by David Turner as a successor to his earlier programming languages SASL and KRC, using some concepts from ML and Hope. It was produced by Research Software Ltd. of England and was the first purely functional language to be commercially supported.
japaneseSummary: 純粋関数型言語。商用サポートされた最初の言語。

name: MIVA Script
summary: Miva Script is a proprietary computer scripting language mainly used for internet applications such as e-commerce. As of 2015, it is developed, maintained and owned by Miva Merchant, Inc., based in San Diego, California. Many web hosting companies support Miva Script on their servers, but it is significantly less widespread than other popular web languages.
japaneseSummary: 電子商取引向け、商用スクリプト言語。

name: ML
summary: ML is a general-purpose, high-level, functional programming language. It is known for its use of the polymorphic HindleyMilner type system, which automatically assigns the data types of most expressions without requiring explicit type annotations, and ensures type safety; there is a formal proof that a well-typed ML program does not cause runtime type errors. While a general-purpose programming language, ML is used heavily in programming language research and is one of the few languages to be completely specified and verified using formal semantics.
japaneseSummary: 高水準関数型言語。型推論で安全。

name: Model 204
summary: Model 204 (M204) is a database management system for IBM and compatible mainframe computers developed and commercialized by Computer Corporation of America. It was announced in 1965, and first deployed in 1972. Implemented in assembly language for IBM System360 and its successors, M204 can deal with very large databases and transaction loads of 1000 TPS.
japaneseSummary: IBMメインフレーム向け大規模データベース管理システム。

name: Modelica
summary: Modelica is an object-oriented, declarative, multi-domain modeling language for component-oriented modeling of complex systems, e.g., systems containing mechanical, electrical, electronic, hydraulic, thermal, control, electric power or process-oriented subcomponents. The free Modelica language is developed by the non-profit Modelica Association.
japaneseSummary: オブジェクト指向、宣言型の多領域モデル言語。

name: Modula
summary: The Modula programming language is a descendant of the Pascal language. It was developed in Switzerland, at ETH Zurich, in the mid-1970s by Niklaus Wirth, the same person who designed Pascal. The main innovation of Modula over Pascal is a module system, used for grouping sets of related declarations into program units; hence the name Modula.
japaneseSummary: Pascal言語の後継。モジュールシステムでプログラムを構成。

name: Modula-2
summary: Modula-2 is a structured, procedural programming language developed between 1977 and 19858 by Niklaus Wirth at ETH Zurich. It was created as the language for the operating system and application software of the Lilith personal workstation. It was later used for programming outside the context of the Lilith.
japaneseSummary: 構造化プログラミング言語。1970年代後半～80年代に開発された。

name: Modula-3
summary: Modula-3 is a programming language conceived as a successor to an upgraded version of Modula-2 known as Modula-2. It has been influential in research circles, but it has not been adopted widely in industry. It was designed by Luca Cardelli, James Donahue, Lucille Glassman, Mick Jordan, Bill Kalsow and Greg Nelson at the Digital Equipment Corporation (DEC) Systems Research Center (SRC) and the Olivetti Research Center (ORC) in the late 1980s.
japaneseSummary: Modula-2の後継言語。研究で影響力あり。

name: Mohol
summary: A system programming language is a programming language used for system programming; such languages are designed for writing system software, which usually requires different development approaches when compared with application software.
japaneseSummary: システムプログラミング言語。システムソフトウェア開発に適する。

name: Mojo
summary: Mojo is a programming language in the Python family that is currently under development. It is available both in browsers via Jupyter notebooks, and locally on Linux and macOS. As of February 2025, the Mojo compiler is closed source with an open source standard library.
japaneseSummary: Python系の開発中プログラミング言語。Jupyter Notebookなどブラウザ、Linux/macOSで利用可能。コンパイラは非公開、標準ライブラリはオープンソース。

name: MOO
summary: A MOO is a text-based online virtual reality system to which multiple users (players) are connected at the same time.
japaneseSummary: 複数ユーザーが同時に接続できるテキストベースの仮想現実システム。

name: Mortran
summary: Mortran is an extension of the Fortran programming language used for scientific computation. Mortran code is macro-processed into Fortran code for compilation.
japaneseSummary: 科学計算用Fortran拡張言語。マクロ処理でFortranコードに変換される。

name: Mouse
summary: The Mouse programming language is a small computer programming language developed by Dr. It was developed as an extension of an earlier language called MUSYS, which was used to control digital and analog devices in an electronic music studio.
japaneseSummary: 電子音楽スタジオ向け制御言語「MUSYS」の拡張言語。

name: MPD
summary: Multithreaded, Parallel, and Distributed Programming (MPD) is a concurrent programming language whose syntax is derived from the one used in the book Foundations of Multithreaded, Parallel, and Distributed Programming.
japaneseSummary: マルチスレッド・並列・分散プログラミング言語。

name: MSL
summary: The mIRC scripting language is the scripting language embedded in mIRC and Adiirc, IRC clients for Windows but work with WiNE for Linux.
japaneseSummary: Windows/Linux用IRCクライアントのスクリプト言語。

name: MUMPS
summary: MUMPS, or M, is an imperative, high-level programming language with an integrated transaction processing keyvalue database. It was originally developed at Massachusetts General Hospital for managing patient medical records and hospital laboratory information systems.
japaneseSummary: 命令型言語。トランザクション処理とキーバリューデータベースを統合。

name: MuPAD
summary: MuPAD is a computer algebra system (CAS). Originally developed by the MuPAD research group at the University of Paderborn, Germany, development was taken over by the company SciFace Software GmbH  Co. MuPAD's graphics package was particularly successful, especially considering the era when it was developed.
japaneseSummary: コンピュータ代数システム。グラフィックス処理に優れる。

name: Mutan
summary: Ethereum is a decentralized blockchain with smart contract functionality. Ether is the native cryptocurrency of the platform. Among cryptocurrencies, ether is second only to bitcoin in market capitalization.
japaneseSummary: イーサリアムのスマートコントラクト言語。

name: Napier88
summary: Napier88 is an orthogonally persistent programming language that was designed and implemented at the University of St Andrews, Scotland. The primary designer was Ron Morrison, whose initial designs were extended and implemented by Fred Brown, Richard Connor, and Al Dearle. Napier88 was ahead of its time in many ways, and was the first robustly implemented language to combine a polymorphic type system with orthogonal persistence.
japaneseSummary: 多相型と直交永続性を備えたプログラミング言語。

name: NASM
summary: The Netwide Assembler (NASM) is an assembler and disassembler for the Intel x86 architecture. It can be used to write 16-bit, 32-bit (IA-32) and 64-bit (x86-64) programs. It is considered one of the most popular assemblers for Linux and x86 chips.
japaneseSummary: x86アーキテクチャの組込み言語。

name: Neko
summary: NekoVM is a virtual machine developed by Nicolas Cannasse as part of research and development (RD) efforts at two independent video game developers in Bordeaux, France: first at Motion Twin and then at Shiro Games. NekoVM's native language is the bytecode for a high-level dynamically typed programming language called Neko.
japaneseSummary: フランスのゲーム開発企業で開発された、動的型付けの高水準言語「Neko」のバイトコード実行環境。

name: Nemerle
summary: Nemerle is a general-purpose, high-level, statically typed programming language designed for platforms using the Common Language Infrastructure (.NETMono). It has a simple C-like syntax and a powerful metaprogramming system.
japaneseSummary: .NET/Mono向け、静的型付けの汎用言語。

name: NESL
summary: NESL is a parallel programming language developed at Carnegie Mellon by the SCandAL project and released in 1993.
japaneseSummary: 並列プログラミング言語。カーネギーメロン大で開発。

name: Net.Data
summary: Net.Data is a programming language by IBM used largely for database-backed web applications.
japaneseSummary: IBMのデータベース連携型Webアプリ言語。

name: NetLogo
summary: NetLogo is a programming language and integrated development environment (IDE) for agent-based modeling.
japaneseSummary: エージェントベースモデリング言語。

name: NetRexx
summary: NetRexx is an open source, originally IBM's, variant of the REXX programming language to run on the Java virtual machine. It supports a classic REXX syntax, with no reserved keywords, along with considerable additions to support object-oriented programming in a manner compatible with Java's object model, yet can be used as both a compiled and an interpreted language, with an option of using only data types native to the JVM or the NetRexx runtime package.
japaneseSummary: Java仮想マシン上で動作する、REXX言語のオープンソース版。オブジェクト指向プログラミングもサポート。

name: NewLISP
summary: newLISP is a scripting language, a dialect of the Lisp family of programming languages. It was designed and developed by Lutz Mueller. Because of its small resource requirements, newLISP is excellent for embedded systems applications.
japaneseSummary: LISP方言のスクリプト言語。組込みシステム向け。

name: NEWP
summary: The first machine in the family was the B5000 in 1961, which was optimized for compiling ALGOL 60 programs extremely well, using single-pass compilers.
japaneseSummary: 1961年、ALGOL 60プログラムをワンパスコンパイラで高速にコンパイルする設計。

name: Newspeak
summary: Newspeak is a programming language and platform in the tradition of Smalltalk and Self being developed by a team led by Gilad Bracha.
japaneseSummary: Smalltalk・Selfの流れを汲むプログラミング言語。

name: NewtonScript
summary: NewtonScript is a prototype-based programming language created to write programs for the Newton platform. It is heavily influenced by the Self programming language, but modified to be more suited to needs of mobile and embedded devices.
japaneseSummary: Newtonプラットフォーム向け、プロトタイプ指向言語。

name: Nial
summary: Nial is a high-level array programming language developed from about 1981 by Mike Jenkins of Queen's University, Kingston, Ontario, Canada.
japaneseSummary: 高水準配列処理言語。1981年頃開発。

name: Nickle
summary: Keith Packard is a software developer, best known for his work on the X Window System.
japaneseSummary: プログラミング言語「Nickle」に関する情報なし。

name: Nim
summary: Nim is a general-purpose, multi-paradigm, statically typed, compiled high-level system programming language, designed and developed by a team around Andreas Rumpf. Nim is designed to be "efficient, expressive, and elegant", supporting metaprogramming, functional, message passing, procedural, and object-oriented programming styles by providing several features such as compile time code generation, algebraic data types, a foreign function interface (FFI) with C, C, Objective-C, and JavaScript, and supporting compiling to those same languages as intermediate representations.
japaneseSummary: 汎用、静的型付け、コンパイル型言語。メタプログラミングなど多様なプログラミングスタイルに対応。

name: NITIN
summary: Keith Packard is a software developer, best known for his work on the X Window System.
japaneseSummary: NITIN：Xウィンドウシステム開発で知られる。

name: Non-English-based
summary: Non-English-based programming languages are programming languages that do not use keywords taken from or inspired by English vocabulary.
japaneseSummary: 英語語彙に由来しないプログラミング言語

name: Not eXactly C
summary: Lego Mindstorms NXT is a programmable robotics kit released by Lego on August 2, 2006. A second-generation set, Lego Mindstorms NXT 2.0, was released on August 1, 2009, with a color sensor and other upgrades. The third-generation EV3 was released in September 2013.
japaneseSummary: レゴマインドストームNXTのプログラミング言語。

name: Not Quite C
summary: Lego Mindstorms is a discontinued line of educational kits for building programmable robots based on Lego bricks. It was introduced on 1 September 1998 and discontinued on 31 December 2022.
japaneseSummary: レゴマインドストームのプログラミング言語。

name: NPL
summary: Nord Programming Language (NPL), is a procedural programming language by the Norwegian minicomputer manufacturer Norsk Data.
japaneseSummary: ノルウェーのコンピューターメーカー、ノルスク・データが開発した手続き型言語。

name: NSIS
summary: Nullsoft, Inc. was an American software house founded in Sedona, Arizona in 1997 by programmer Justin Frankel.
japaneseSummary: NSISは、Nullsoft社が開発したインストーラ作成ツール。

name: Nu
summary: Nu is an interpreted object-oriented programming language, with a Lisp-like syntax, created by Tim Burks as an alternative scripting language to program OS X through its Cocoa application programming interface (API).
japaneseSummary: オブジェクト指向のインタプリタ言語。Lisp風構文でmacOSアプリをCocoa APIで制御。

name: NWScript
summary: Neverwinter Nights is a role-playing video game developed by BioWare. Interplay Entertainment was originally set to publish the game, but financial difficulties led to it being taken over by Infogrames, who released the game under their Atari range of titles. It is the first installment in the Neverwinter Nights series and was released for Microsoft Windows on June 18, 2002.
japaneseSummary: Neverwinter Nightsのスクリプト言語。

name: NXT-G
summary: Lego Mindstorms NXT is a programmable robotics kit released by Lego on August 2, 2006. A second-generation set, Lego Mindstorms NXT 2.0, was released on August 1, 2009, with a color sensor and other upgrades. The third-generation EV3 was released in September 2013.
japaneseSummary: レゴマインドストームNXTのプログラミング環境。

name: oXML
summary: o:XML is an open source, dynamically typed, general-purpose object-oriented programming language based on XML-syntax. It has threads, exception handling, regular expressions and namespaces. Additionally o:XML has an expression language very similar to XPath that allows functions to be invoked on nodes and node sets.
japaneseSummary: XML構文に基づく、動的型付けのオブジェクト指向汎用言語。

name: Oak
summary: Oak is a discontinued programming language created by James Gosling in 1989, initially for Sun Microsystems' set-top box project.
japaneseSummary: 1989年、サン・マイクロシステムズ向けに開発された、現在は使われていないプログラミング言語。

name: Oberon
summary: Oberon is a general-purpose programming language first published in 1987 by Niklaus Wirth and the latest member of the Wirthian family of ALGOL-like languages. Oberon was the result of a concentrated effort to increase the power of Modula-2, the direct successor of Pascal, and simultaneously to reduce its complexity. Its principal new feature is the concept of data type extension of record types.
japaneseSummary: 1987年発表の汎用言語。モジュール2の後継で、レコード型の拡張機能を持つ。

name: OBJ2
summary: OBJ is a programming language family introduced by Joseph Goguen in 1976, and further worked on by Jose Meseguer.
japaneseSummary: 1976年にゴゲンが提唱、メセゲールらによって発展したプログラミング言語。

name: Object Lisp
summary: Object Lisp was a computer programming language, a dialect of the Lisp language. It was an object-oriented extension for the Lisp dialect Lisp Machine Lisp, designed by Lisp Machines, Inc. Object Lisp was also an early example of prototype-based programming.
japaneseSummary: Lispマシンのオブジェクト指向拡張言語。プロトタイプ指向の初期例。

name: Object Pascal
summary: Object Pascal is an extension to the programming language Pascal that provides object-oriented programming (OOP) features such as classes and methods.
japaneseSummary: オブジェクト指向機能を持つPascal言語の拡張。

name: Object REXX
summary: Object REXX is a high-level, general-purpose, interpreted, object-oriented (class-based) programming language. Today it is generally referred to as ooRexx, which is the maintained and direct open-source successor to Object REXX.
japaneseSummary: オブジェクト指向の高級言語。ooRexxが後継。

name: Objective-C
summary: Objective-C is a high-level general-purpose, object-oriented programming language that adds Smalltalk-style message passing (messaging) to the C programming language. Originally developed by Brad Cox and Tom Love in the early 1980s, it was selected by NeXT for its NeXTSTEP operating system. Due to Apple macOSs direct lineage from NeXTSTEP, Objective-C was the standard language used, supported, and promoted by Apple for developing macOS and iOS applications from 1997, when Apple purchased NeXT until the introduction of the Swift language in 2014.
japaneseSummary: C言語にSmalltalk風のメッセージ機構を追加したオブジェクト指向言語。

name: ObjectLOGO
summary: Logo is an educational programming language, designed in 1967 by Wally Feurzeig, Seymour Papert, and Cynthia Solomon. The name was coined by Feurzeig while he was at Bolt, Beranek and Newman, and derives from the Greek logos, meaning 'word' or 'thought'.
japaneseSummary: 教育用プログラミング言語。

name: Obliq
summary: Obliq is an interpreted, object-oriented programming language designed to make distributed, and locally multithreaded, computing simpler and easier to program, while providing program safety and an implicit type system. The interpreter is written in Modula-3, and provides Obliq with full access to Modula-3's network objects abilities. A type inference algorithm for record concatenation, subtyping, and recursive types has been developed for Obliq.
japaneseSummary: 分散・マルチスレッド処理を容易にした、オブジェクト指向のインタプリタ言語。

name: OCaml
summary: OCaml is a general-purpose, high-level, multi-paradigm programming language which extends the Caml dialect of ML with object-oriented features. OCaml was created in 1996 by Xavier Leroy, Jrme Vouillon, Damien Doligez, Didier Rmy, Ascnder Surez, and others.
japaneseSummary: オブジェクト指向機能を持つML方言の拡張言語。

name: occam
summary: occam is a programming language which is concurrent and builds on the communicating sequential processes (CSP) process algebra, and shares many of its features. It is named after philosopher William of Ockham after whom Occam's razor is named.
japaneseSummary: 並列処理言語。CSPに基づく。

name: Octave
summary: GNU Octave is a scientific programming language for scientific computing and numerical computation. Octave helps in solving linear and nonlinear problems numerically, and for performing other numerical experiments using a language that is mostly compatible with MATLAB. As part of the GNU Project, it is free software under the terms of the GNU General Public License.
japaneseSummary: MATLAB互換の科学技術計算言語。

name: OmniMark
summary: OmniMark is a fourth-generation programming language used mostly in the publishing industry. It is currently a proprietary software product of Stilo International. As of July 2022, the most recent release of OmniMark was 11.0.
japaneseSummary: 出版業界向け、第4世代プログラミング言語。

name: Opa
summary: Opa is a programming language for developing scalable web applications. It is free and open-source software released under a GNU Affero General Public License (AGPLv3), and an MIT License.
japaneseSummary: スケーラブルなWebアプリ開発言語。フリーでオープンソース。

name: Opal
summary: OPAL is a functional programming language first developed at Technische Universitt Berlin.
japaneseSummary: 関数型プログラミング言語。ベルリン工科大学発。

name: OpenCL
summary: OpenCL is a framework for writing programs that execute across heterogeneous platforms consisting of central processing units (CPUs), graphics processing units (GPUs), digital signal processors (DSPs), field-programmable gate arrays (FPGAs) and other processors or hardware accelerators.
japaneseSummary: 様々なハードウェアで動作する並列処理のフレームワーク。

name: OpenQASM
summary: Open Quantum Assembly Language is a programming language designed for describing quantum circuits and algorithms for execution on quantum computers.
japaneseSummary: 量子回路・アルゴリズム記述言語。

name: OPS5
summary: OPS5 is a rule-based or production system computer language, notable as the first such language to be used in a successful expert system, the R1XCON system used to configure VAX computers.
japaneseSummary: ルールベース言語で、R1XCONシステムに採用。

name: OptimJ
summary: OptimJ is an extension for Java with language support for writing optimization models and abstractions for bulk data processing. The extensions and the proprietary product implementing the extensions were developed by Ateji which went out of business in September 2011.
japaneseSummary: Java拡張言語。大規模データ処理の最適化モデル記述をサポート。
